snippet: The first presidential debate was a glaringly public confrontation between President Obama and Mitt Romney that looked oddly intimate and personal.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column on the first presidential debate says it was a glaringly public confrontation between President Obama and Mitt Romney that looked oddly intimate and personal, playing to the estimated tens of millions of people expected to tune in.
lead_paragraph: The first presidential debate was a glaringly public confrontation between President Obama and Mitt Romney that looked oddly intimate and personal.

headline.main: The Choirboy and the Headmaster, and a Faceoff Without Fireworks
headline.print_headline: The Choirboy and the Headmaster, and a Faceoff Without Fireworks
